desc: The protein FUBP1, binds single-stranded DNA, including regulatory DNA elements upstream of genes. Among the motifs it binds is the far upstream element (FUSE), which is located upstream of the MYC oncogene (PMID: 22926519). Regulation of MYC by FUBP1 is complex; while overexpression of FUBP1 can activate transcription of the MYC gene, it has also been reported that inactivating mutations of FUBP1 activate MYC expression (PMID: 20420426). FUBP1 is also known to bind RNA (PMID: 23818605), e.g. in order to regulate the splicing of MDM2, an important negative regulator of the tumor suppressor TP53 (PMID: 24798327). FUBP1 was reported to be mutated at relatively low frequency (<8%) across a variety of cancers (cBioPortal, Nov 3, 2015). It is most frequently mutated in gliomas, which also show frequent deletion of 1p, where the FUBP1 gene is located (PMID: 22869205, 21817013).
articles/0/title: Quantitative characterization of the interactions among c-myc transcriptional regulators FUSE, FBP, and FIR.
articles/1/title: Frequent ATRX, CIC, FUBP1 and IDH1 mutations refine the classification of malignant gliomas.
articles/2/title: Far upstream element binding protein 1: a commander of transcription, translation and beyond.
articles/3/title: Far upstream element-binding protein 1 and RNA secondary structure both mediate second-step splicing repression.
articles/3/journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
articles/4/title: The splicing factor FUBP1 is required for the efficient splicing of oncogene MDM2 pre-mRNA.
articles/5/title: Mutations in CIC and FUBP1 contribute to human oligodendroglioma.

desc: FUBP1 encodes a DNA-binding protein that is involved in regulating the expression of the MYC oncogene. Mutations or overexpression of FUBP1 are found in brain cancers, among others.
